title: Hidden curved spaces in Bosonic Kitaev model
abstract:
Quantum matter in curved spaces exhibits remarkable properties unattainable
in flat spaces. To access curved spaces in laboratories, the conventional
wisdom is that physical distortions need to be implemented into a system. In
contrast to this belief, here, we show that two hyperbolic surfaces readily
exist in bosonic Kitaev model in the absence of any physical distortions and
give rise to a range of intriguing phenomena, such as chiral quantum transport
or chiral reaction-diffusion. A finite chemical potential couples these two
hyperbolic surfaces, delivering a quantum sensor whose sensitivity grows
exponentially with the size of the system. Our results provide experimentalists
with an unprecedented opportunity to explore intriguing quantum phenomena in
curve spaces without distortion or access non-Hermitian phenomena without
dissipation. Our work also suggests a new class of quantum sensors in which
geometry amplifies small signals.
